Detailed Description

Describes a segment on the boundry.

A segment on the boundry is a segment (routeable item, i.e. street segent or ferry item) that might have connections from other maps.

Definition at line 233 of file ExternalConnections.h.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum BoundrySegment::closeNode_t
 

The different cases of how nodes are close to the boundry.

Enumeration values:
node0close  Node 0 is close to the boundry.
node1close  Node 1 is close to the boundry.
noNodeClose  Both node 0 and node 1 is close to the boundry.

BoundrySegment::BoundrySegment (  uint32  routeableItemID,
closeNode_t  closeNodeValue
) 
 

Create a boundrySegment with the smallest possible information.

Parameters:
routeableItemID ID of the corresponding routeable item { on this map}.
closeNodeValue Which node(s) are close to the boundry, 0=node0, 1=node1, 2=bothNodes.

Add one connection.

Parameters:

Returns:
True if the connection added alright, false otherwise.

uint32 BoundrySegment::getNbrConnectionsToNode (  byte  i  )  const [inline]
 

Use this method to get the number of external connections to one of the nodes.

Parameters:
i The node (0 or 1).
Returns:
The number of external connections to node i. If i == 0 then the number of connections to node 0 is returned, otherwise the number of connections to node 1.

Member Data Documentation

closeNode_t BoundrySegment::m_closeNode [private]
 

Which node(s) of this segment is/are close to the boundry.

0 means node 0 is close, 1 means node 1 is close and 2 means both nodes are close.
